summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 23, 2019. It documents an interview with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione regarding an incident involving his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein, which occurred after midnight. Tartaglione reported waking to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, prompting him to call for staff assistance.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, as of July 23, 2019.
Epstein's cellmate was Nicholas Tartaglione, a pre-trial inmate facing murder and drug conspiracy charges.
An incident occurred after midnight where Tartaglione woke to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, leading Tartaglione to call for staff.
Tartaglione was in the SHU for possession of a cell phone at the time of this incident.
The document is an internal Bureau of Prisons memorandum, classified as CONFIDENTIAL and part of the SDNY case files.
